Structs/CharacteristicIdentifier.html#/s.abstract: Check equality between a CharacteristicIdentifier and a CBCharacterstic.

Structs/ServiceIdentifier.html.name: ServiceIdentifier
Structs/ServiceIdentifier.html.abstract: A wrapper for CBUUID specific to a service to help distinguish it from a CBUUID of a charactersitc.

Structs/DataPadding.html.name: DataPadding
Structs/DataPadding.html.abstract: Helper object to create padding in packets being constructed.

Structs/CharacteristicIdentifier.html.name: CharacteristicIdentifier
Structs/CharacteristicIdentifier.html.abstract: A wrapper for CBUUID specific to a characteristic to help distinguish it from a CBUUID of a service.

Structs/PeripheralIdentifier.html.name: PeripheralIdentifier
Structs/PeripheralIdentifier.html.abstract: Uniquely identifies a peripheral to the current iOS device. The UUID changes and is different on different iOS devices.

Protocols/ConnectionObserver.html#/s:FP7.name: bluetoothAvailable(_:)
Protocols/ConnectionObserver.html#/s:FP7.abstract: Called whenever Bluetooth availability changes, as well as when an object first subscribes to observing Bluetooth events.

Protocols/ListenRestorer.html#/s:FP7Blue.name: willRestoreListen(on:)
Protocols/ListenRestorer.html#/s:FP7Blue.abstract: Notify the conforming class that there is a characteristic being listened on, but it doesn’t have any listen callbacks.

Protocols/ListenRestorer.html.name: ListenRestorer
Protocols/ListenRestorer.html.abstract: A class protocol allowing notification of a characteristic being listened on, and provides an opportunity to restore its listen callback during Bluetooth state restoration.

Protocols/Receivable.html.name: Receivable
Protocols/Receivable.html.abstract: Protocol to indicate that a type can be received from the bluetooth connection.

Protocols/Sendable.html.name: Sendable
Protocols/Sendable.html.abstract: Protocol to indicate that a type can be sent via the bluetooth connection.

Protocols/ConnectionObserver.html.name: ConnectionObserver
Protocols/ConnectionObserver.html.abstract: A protocol allowing conforming objects registered to Bluejay to optionally respond to Bluetooth connection events.

Extensions/CBService.html#/s:FE7BluejayC.name: characteristic(with:)
Extensions/CBService.html#/s:FE7BluejayC.abstract: Find a characteristic on a service by CBUUID.

Extensions/CBPeripheral.html#/s:FE7Bluej.name: service(with:)
Extensions/CBPeripheral.html#/s:FE7Bluej.abstract: Find a service on a peripheral by UUID.

Extensions/Integer.html.name: Integer
Extensions/Integer.html.abstract: Extensions to existing primitive types to make them Sendable and Receivable.

Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html#/s:FO7B.name: disable
Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html#/s:FO7B.abstract: Bluejay will not receieve state restoration callbacks from CoreBluetooth.

Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html#/s:FO7B.name: enable
Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html#/s:FO7B.abstract: Bluejay will receive state restoration callbacks from CoreBluetooth.

Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html#/s:FO7B.name: enableWithListenRestorer
Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html#/s:FO7B.abstract: Bluejay will receive state restoration callbacks from CoreBluetooth and attempt to restore listens when necessary using the provided listen restorer.

Enums/ReadResult.html.name: ReadResult
Enums/ReadResult.html.abstract: Indicates a successful or failed read attempt, where the success case contains the value read.

Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html.name: BackgroundRestoreMode
Enums/BackgroundRestoreMode.html.abstract: Determines how Bluejay should opt-in to CoreBluetooth state restoration.

Enums/WriteResult.html.name: WriteResult
Enums/WriteResult.html.abstract: Indicates a successful or failed write attempt.

Enums/ListenAction.html.name: ListenAction
Enums/ListenAction.html.abstract: Indicates whether the current listening action on a characteristic should continue or end.

Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:F.name: read(from:)
Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:F.abstract: Read a value from the specified characteristic synchronously.

Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:F.name: write(to:value:)
Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:F.abstract: Write a value from the specified characteristic synchronously.

Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:F.name: listen(to:completion:)
Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:F.abstract: Listen for changes on a specified characterstic synchronously.

Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:F.name: writeAndListen(writeTo:value:listenTo:timeoutInSeconds:completion:)
Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html#/s:F.abstract: Handle a compound operation consisting of writing on one characterstic followed by listening on another for some streamed data.

Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:FC7Bluejay10P.name: listen(to:completion:)
Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:FC7Bluejay10P.abstract: Listen for notifications on a specified characterstic.

Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:FC7Bluejay10P.name: restoreListen(to:completion:)
Classes/Peripheral.html#/s:FC7Bluejay10P.abstract: Restore a (believed to be) active listening session, so if we start up in response to a notification, we can receive it.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:vC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: uuid
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:vC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Helps distinguish one Bluejay instance from another.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:vC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: isBluetoothAvailable
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:vC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Allows checking whether Bluetooth is powered on.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:vC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: isConnecting
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:vC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Allows checking whether Bluejay is currently connecting to a peripheral.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:vC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: isConnected
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:vC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Allows checking whether Bluejay is currently connected to a peripheral.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:vC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: isDisconnecting
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:vC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Allows checking whether Bluejay is currently disconnecting from a peripheral.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:vC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: isScanning
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:vC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Allows checking whether Bluejay is currently scanning.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: init()
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Initializing a Bluejay instance will not yet initialize the CoreBluetooth stack. An explicit call to start running a Bluejay instance after it is intialized is required because in cases where a state resotration is trying to restore a listen on a characteristic, a listen restorer must be available before the CoreBluetooth stack is re-initialized. This two-step startup allows you to insert and gaurantee the setup of your listen restorer in between the initialization of Bluejay and the initialization of the CoreBluetooth stack triggered via this call.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: start(connectionObserver:backgroundRestore:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Starting Bluejay will initialize the CoreBluetooth stack. Initializing a Bluejay instance will not yet initialize the CoreBluetooth stack. An explicit call to start running a Bluejay instance after it is intialized is required because in cases where a state resotration is trying to restore a listen on a characteristic, a listen restorer must be available before the CoreBluetooth stack is re-initialized. This two-step startup allows you to insert and gaurantee the setup of your listen restorer in between the initialization of Bluejay and the initialization of the CoreBluetooth stack triggered via this call.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: cancelEverything(_:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: This will cancel the current and all pending operations in the Bluejay queue, as well as stop any ongoing scan, and disconnect any connected peripheral.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: register(observer:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Register for notifications on Bluetooth connection events and state changes. Unregistering is not required, Bluejay will unregister for you if the observer is no longer in memory.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: unregister(observer:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Unregister for notifications on Bluetooth connection events and state changes. Unregistering is not required, Bluejay will unregister for you if the observer is no longer in memory.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: scan(duration:allowDuplicates:serviceIdentifiers:discovery:expired:stopped:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Scan for the peripheral(s) specified.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: stopScanning()
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Stops an ongoing scan if there is one, otherwise it does nothing.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: connect(_:completion:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Attempt to connect directly to a known peripheral. The call will fail if Bluetooth is not available, or if Bluejay is already connected. Making a connection request while Bluejay is scanning will also cause Bluejay to stop the current scan for you behind the scene prior to fulfilling your connection request.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: disconnect(completion:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Disconnect the currently connected peripheral. Providing a completion block is not necessary, but useful in most cases.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: read(from:completion:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Read from the specified characteristic.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: write(to:value:completion:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Write to the specified characteristic.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: listen(to:completion:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Listen for notifications on the specified characteristic.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: endListen(to:completion:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: End listening on the specified characteristic.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: restoreListen(to:completion:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Restore a (believed to be) active listening session, so if we start up in response to a notification, we can receive it.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: run(backgroundTask:completionOnMainThread:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: One of the three ways to run a background task using a synchronous interface to the Bluetooth peripheral. This is the simplest one as the background task will not return any typed values back to the completion block on finishing the background task, except for thrown errors, and it also doesn’t provide an input for an object that might need thread safe access.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: run(backgroundTask:completionOnMainThread:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: One of the three ways to run a background task using a synchronous interface to the Bluetooth peripheral. This one allows the background task to potentially return a typed value back to the completion block on finishing the background task successfully.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: run(userData:backgroundTask:completionOnMainThread:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: One of the three ways to run a background task using a synchronous interface to the Bluetooth peripheral. This one allows the background task to potentially return a typed value back to the completion block on finishing the background task successfully, as well as supplying an object for thread safe access inside the background task.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:ZFC7Bluejay7Blue.name: combine(sendables:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:ZFC7Bluejay7Blue.abstract: A helper function to take an array of Sendables and combine their data together.

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: centralManagerDidUpdateState(_:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: centralManager(_:willRestoreState:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: centralManager(_:didConnect:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: centralManager(_:didDisconnectPeripheral:error:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: centralManager(_:didFailToConnect:error:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.name: centralManager(_:didDiscover:advertisementData:rssi:)
Classes/Bluejay.html#/s:FC7Bluejay7Bluej.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/Bluejay.html.name: Bluejay
Classes/Bluejay.html.abstract: Bluejay is a simple wrapper around CoreBluetooth that focuses on making a common usage case as straight forward as possible: a single connected peripheral that the user is interacting with regularly (think most personal electronics devices that have an associated iOS app: fitness trackers, guitar amps, etc).

Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html.name: SynchronizedPeripheral
Classes/SynchronizedPeripheral.html.abstract: A synchronous interface to the Bluetooth peripheral, intended to be used from a background thread to perform multi-part operations without the need for a complicated callback or promise setup.
